title: Grade 6
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

FA80C349374541E58CF65197CD7CC716.description:
Use general academic and domain- specific
words and phrases across contexts.

4A5A7860D87748BE82FBD94BF0C7C9BA.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words by identifying
other words with similar and different meanings.

F25F92551EDC4E558E00DA08F793B889.description:
Identify the meaning of simple similes (e.g., The
man was as big as a tree.).

18AA58F78ED54B928705F9F70D400097.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word relationships
and use.

D931C9D05111485A9289CB38BE7DA330.description:
Seek clarification and meaning support when
unfamiliar words are encountered while reading or
communicating.

459CDC9742734747B9EC96EFD3247093.description:
Use frequently occurring root words (e.g., like) and
the words that result when affixes are added (e.g.,
liked, disliked, liking).

EA9AAFF2B6224D449528F9785C24E6B4.description:
Use context to determine which word is missing
from a content area text.

85E1842B522C40749F7E81637373A971.description:
Vary use of language when the listener or reader
does not understand the initial attempt.

C5870906DB8945CA80EA33747E505AAD.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes when
communicating.

A75158DF5BD0458B88AD672C3B489646.description:
Spell untaught words phonetically, drawing on
letter-sound relationships and common spelling
patterns.

3B6F9369C7F24078B726645081046839.description: Use question marks at the end of written questions.

6530E90C0FD44FD18ED281805A58741D.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions of
standard English.

80E5B7CA455E43E0A464AFA94AE7270A.description:
Use personal pronouns (e.g., he, she, and they)
correctly

A2D3FB20281143B5845864E53470A997.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar and
usage when communicating.

75DB15D220E741E8AAB436244620F657.description:
Use formal and informal language as
appropriate to the communication partner.

9E739C93792046929302925FE82A4075.description:
Select an auditory, visual, or tactual display to
clarify the information in presentations.

364502569B0B4281A7C10D5BB64966D0.description:
Present findings on a topic including
descriptions, facts, or details.

DF46CF9067CA44919C4F583B21C106BA.description:
Identify the reasons and evidence supporting
the claims made by the speaker.

2E994E29A41C420C82365EFF6CAE5FCF.description:
Identify information presented in diverse media
and formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively, orally) that relates
to a topic, text, or issue under study.

83705AF1BA3244268C5EE146CD72985A.description: Restate key ideas expressed in the discussion.

40A9595A00B34ECBA8790455082CF838.description:
Ask and answer questions specific to the topic,
text, or issue under discussion.

E63F92EC0C8A409BAD2999CEC8ACFA7C.description:
With guidance and support from adults and peers,
follow simple, agreed-upon rules for discussions
and contribute information.

5CE9366DDD4D4C848853BE4F3B29C12D.description: Come to discussions prepared to share information.

5B81D6B6BE0846A09CA663C8DA811BE1.description:
Write routinely for a variety of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

E0533D03E82E42F9AD89761659CC81BE.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 6 Reading
Standards to informational texts (e.g., “Can produce an
argument by logically organizing the claims and the
supporting reasons and evidence.”).

4C383B6B5D3A45509903B08628FE8C09.description:
Apply Essential Elements of Grade 6 Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Compare a text version
of a story, drama, or poem with an audio, video, or live
version of the text.”).

BA96B48F5C6E42FCA48C01A9772B2006.description:
Use information from literary and informational
text to support writing.

6AE2D4FBB1A544DA8130C87AF8E831A7.description:
Gather information from multiple print and digital
sources that relates to a given topic.

CBF4104890734B478AD50353F14068C5.description:
Conduct short research projects to answer a
question.

3406CF663CBC46B8A839A60AD9771794.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

97B1460726864686924767D7D583461D.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce writing while interacting and collaborating with
others.

86FDE2ED503D43BAA7B4BFCCE09A3AA0.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, plan before writing and revise own writing.

228E707FC998419FBE77DA72CF4AC682.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate for the task,
purpose, or audience.

41DC2B1ECBC94A21ADA3529BD7BCDBF4.description:
Use words that convey specific details about the
experience or event.

E6639E1802E5416399607C18AD32CFC2.description: Use words that establish the time frame.

1818231EBE664D09930436F42F615EC3.description:
Write a narrative about a real or imagined
experience introducing the experience and
including two or more events.

877367A70EDE44EF8E7B8C54637EE198.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

BF7A29DF3FEB43398453BC5543D21D96.description:
Provide facts, details, or other information related
to the topic.

248384EBE0C24A39B30737A00D2E520D.description:
Introduce a topic and write to convey ideas and
information about it including visual, tactual, or
multimedia information as appropriate.

72A13C6301D547F788DF75B5791F6F14.description: Write to share information supported by details.

AC83B55F12F34917844E9AEACA00EEF6.description:
Write one or more reasons to support a claim about
a topic or text.

CB6CF616C3314635BFD934CC35BBFF27.description: Write a claim about a topic or text.

A6FC8477045846669F70C7BF237F98CF.description: Write claims about topics or text.

9D09809F05A440ADBD993912AC35BB6B.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
reading or listening to literary nonfiction.

2B47857FC7FF4289A653F17DA5FF5091.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

BD897B22CCE44E5BAE1648DA228CF325.description:
Compare and contrast how two texts describe
the same event.

0127465C3FA44F8095B2463A61AC48CF.description: Distinguish claims in a text supported by reason.

FFF430C03339491D819CB05F1CD55AB3.description:
Find similarities in information presented in
different media or formats as well as in text.

33358DDB357145569EBD7BDC97A10E29.description:
Identify words or phrases in the text that describe
or show the author’s point of view.

C49C74C59CAC43B4B71D658B1C8935AA.description:
Determine how the title fits the structure of the
text.

DCB81A95315449D9984A635CB6C8C67A.description:
Determine how word choice changes the
meaning of a text.

8CD20275F132407C88FC944C42BB2176.description:
Identify a detail that elaborates upon individuals,
events, or ideas introduced in a text.

07DF2BBA8FA64897BF35B9B4C6B23EB0.description:
Determine the main idea of a passage and
details or facts related to it.

833AC937CC6D4E6C9DBD902D28687272.description:
Analyze a text to determine what it says explicitly
as well as what inferences
should be drawn.

07470FFB57E24B3E802A36A8521C96DC.description:
Demonstrate understanding of text while
actively reading or listening to stories, dramas, or poetry.

769A89E19AC542498FEB71F16FB55CC0.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

794837399BF8416A83FC9C9AA4F0E542.description:
Compare and contrast stories, myths, or texts
with similar topics or themes.

2ACC0ACA09464B1D930F67EA3B007FAA.description:
Compare the experience of reading or listening
to a written story, drama or poem with the experience of
watching video or live performance of the same text.

61CCF726AFAC4623AD751DEC0383DC61.description:
Identify words or phrases in the text that
describe or show what the narrator or speaker is thinking or
feeling.

4650843A5E4345F8B5770100B433884D.description:
Determine the structure of a text (e.g., story,
poem, or drama).

8A8E6E80B6974219B58BF7E23CF984C6.description:
Determine how word choice changes the
meaning in a text.

ADA2591E7DE44E048628A18261DCE00B.description:
Can identify how a character responds to a
challenge in a story.

238A7C7A396E42BEB4B188B05046EBFA.description:
Identify details in a text that are related to the
theme or central idea.

271F19229046406ABD1D3CC0C93C5126.description:
Determine what a text says explicitly as well as
what simple inferences must be
drawn.
